subject_terms_3: Textile art and design  1942-1945 Japanese occupation Peranakan costumes
physical_appearance: This is a white kebaya with geometric (checkered) stitching. It has leaf/ foliage interspersed with swirl motifs lining its edges, sleeves, and hems. The material is sheer, and is worn as an open jacket.
sgcool_label_text: This white kebaya has a geometric stitching on the body of the cloth, and an embroidered leaf and swirl pattern around the edges. The kebaya is a loose open jacket usually worn by Peranakan women of the Straits Settlements, Indonesia and Indo-European women of the late 19th to 20th century It has embroidered edges, which became popular during the mid-twentieth century and replaced lace as the decoration of choice along the border of the blouses. This kebaya belonged to a Chinese woman who was living in Java during the Japanese Occupation. She took on Peranakan dress and identity to adopt as low a profile  as possible in order not to attract attention
subject_terms_1: foliage (motif)  womenswear  Sino-Japanese War, 1937-1945 folk costume
subject_terms_2: Peranakan embroidery  Straits Settlements  Foliation (Architecture and design)  Sino-Japanese War, 1937-1945 Ethnic costume
